intro: Nothopanax arboreus, commonly known as the tropical shrub or tree, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are usually opposite or alternate in arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in humid, warm climates. Its botanical structure makes it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
